src.apps package¶

Submodules¶

src.apps.app module¶

This module provides an interface for an App.

class App¶

Bases: object

An abstract class representing the format of all Apps.

allowed_options = {}¶
abstract validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.

abstract run()¶

Runs the application.

src.apps.app_factory module¶

class AppFactory¶

Bases: object

A class that is used to create app objects

apps = {'cat': <class 'apps.cat.CatApp'>, 'cd': <class 'apps.cd.CdApp'>, 'cut': <class 'apps.cut.CutApp'>, 'echo': <class 'apps.echo.EchoApp'>, 'find': <class 'apps.find.FindApp'>, 'grep': <class 'apps.grep.GrepApp'>, 'head': <class 'apps.head.HeadApp'>, 'ls': <class 'apps.ls.LsApp'>, 'pwd': <class 'apps.pwd.PwdApp'>, 'sort': <class 'apps.sort.SortApp'>, 'tail': <class 'apps.tail.TailApp'>, 'uniq': <class 'apps.uniq.UniqApp'>}¶

A dictionary that maps app names to their classes

Type

dict

no_glob = {'find'}¶

A set of apps that don’t require globbing

Type

set

static get_app(app_str: str, opts: list) → apps.app.App¶

Returns an app object based on the app_str given.

Parameters

  • app_str (str) – A string that represents the command to be called. If app_str starts with ‘_’ the app will be treated as unsafe

  • opts (list) – A List of arguments that should be passed to the app.

Returns

An app object that is ready to be run

Return type

app (App)

src.apps.cat module¶

class CatApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Application representing the bash command: cat [FILES]…

allowed_options = {}¶
run(inp, out)¶

Executes that cat command on the given arguments. :param inp: The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects. :param out: The output queue. :return: Returns the output queue.

validate_args()¶

Ensures the options are valid. :raises AppRunException: If any option is given.

src.apps.cd module¶

This module represents the cd bash command

class CdApp(args=[])¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Application representing the bash command: cd [DIRECTORY]

run(inp, out)¶

Changes current working directory

If a FULL DIRECTORY is supplied changes current directory to the given one

If a RELATIVE DIRECTORY is supplied changed current directory to the given one

If NO DIRECTORY is given changes directory to the root

validate_args()¶

Check that the number of arguments is greater than 1 and if the given path exists.

src.apps.cut module¶

class CutApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Executes bash application cut: cut -b [INTERVALS] [PATHS]* If paths is empty or ‘-‘ stdin is used

run(inp, out)¶

Executes the cut command extracting specified bytes from text. :param inp: The string text to cut bytes from. :param out: The deque used to store the result of the application

validate_args()¶

Ensures the options are valid. :raises AppRunException: If -b option is missing or -b is not the only option.

src.apps.echo module¶

This module represents the echo bash command.

class EchoApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

echo [INPUT] [INPUT] …

run(inp, out)¶

Returns all the input args as a space seperated string.

validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given arguments are valid.

src.apps.grep module¶

class GrepApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Application representing the bash command: grep [PATTERN] [FILE]*

run(inp, out)¶

Performs the grep operation on all specified paths. :param inp: The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects.

validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.

src.apps.ls module¶

class LsApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Lists all apps in the current or given directory

run(inp, out)¶

ls [DIRECTORY]

if NO ARGUMENTS provided print files in the current directory

if ONE OR MORE ARGUMENTS provided print files in directories specified

validate_args()¶

Check is all paths in args exist. :raises: AppContextException if the path given does not exist.

src.apps.sort module¶

class SortApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

Sorts the contents of a file/stdin line by line and prints the result to stdout.

sort [OPTIONS] [FILE]

OPTIONS:

-r sorts lines in reverse order

FILE is the name of the file. If not specified, uses stdin.

run(inp, out)¶
validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.

src.apps.uniq module¶

class UniqApp(args)¶

Bases: apps.app.App

run(inp, out)¶

Executes that uniq command on the given arguments. :param inp: The input args of the command, only used for piping and redirects. :param out: The output deque. :return: Returns the output deque.

validate_args()¶

Ensures the options are valid. :raises AppRunException: If any other option other than -i is given, or multiple paths are given as args

src.apps.unsafe module¶

Bases: apps.app.App

run(inp, out)¶

Runs the application.

validate_args()¶

Checks whether the given args are appropriate for the application.
